title: Metro Meat Market in Forest Hills
text:
Delicious meal of sliced sausage in garlic and oil with pasta shells and broccolini! Nice sized container of food! Enough for two people! Just add a glass of wine to your meal! I love the idea of not wasting food and making good food available to the general public at reduced prices!

I will definitely use the App again and see what else I can enjoy!

title: Amazing app idea
text: I believe this app is new to San Antonio because we don‚Äôt have a lot of restaurants on here yet, but the ones I have gotten surprise bags from are great! I love this idea because you can try new dishes for a fraction of the price AND restaurants don‚Äôt waste food. A GREAT app! I hope more restaurants in the SA area sign up!

title: Not sure about this
text:
I'm reluctant to this service because they have poor reviews on TrustPilot about lack of customer service AND they don't allow personalized reviews on the app itself (star rating per restaurant means very little) so the lack of transparency is concerning. 

Won't try until changes are made, otherwise seems shady, even if the intention might be to not waste food...

title: Share this app!
text: What a wonderful surprise to find this app. Helping to avoid food waste at the same time. Getting delicious products for a low price. Definitely will continue using this app over and over in every city I visit where available .

title: Great app
text: I wish they have more places that we can collect the food,I think they should go less $ in some places I been so desapointed in some places where I pick up the food,the quality and is less food that I spected,but they are some places the food is really good!

title: First time üò¨
text:
So I went to pick up my order and I was early,
They were very helpful in explaining how it works, I received my order üòã and I swiped to confirm,
This place was great throughout my visit,I have bought pizza from the past without the app, this made it even more enjoyable üòÄ

title: Excited to try this- but nothing available in my area
text: This app seems like a great concept and I was really looking forward to trying it. However, after downloading the app, I saw there were only 2 restaurants listed within a 20 mile radius of where I live, and I‚Äôve never even heard of those restaurants (and they weren‚Äôt even close to me). Wish there was a way to see the participating restaurants before downloading the app

title: Very Happy
text: I recommend this app for any small or large family who is serious about making some savings on their weekly grocery shopping cost. There is a tremendous variety of healthy food that am sure will satisfy and fill you up.

title: Perfect for those on a budget
text: I love the idea of this app. You can get good quality food for cheap because they will go in the trash otherwise. Amazing if you‚Äôre on a budget. Hopefully this app can get more traffic amongst Portland - it definitely follows within the ethos of the city. Overall great idea!

title: Very cheap, but always good
text: The prices are cheap because it is food from the end of the day, but the food is always good quality and the price is amazing. Get a meal for two under 10 bucks is the norm. The items like donuts might be a bit misshapen but they are still amazing

title: Added Feature request :)
text: Truly Love this app concept of reducing food waste. It would be great if you allow us to see other customers reviews and also give us more details of the restaurant like what type or what kind of food they sale. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Add a filter
text:
Hii!! So the app concept is really great and I love it. It‚Äôd just be a bit more helpful if you added filters so we could pick the time we want to pick up the food and it‚Äôll show us the places offering the food for those specific times, so we can reserve for ahead. Also a sorting filter which allows us to see the places nearest first and sorts them out by increasing distance. 
K, bye!

title: Good for the planet and your pockets
text: Don‚Äôt know how this app found me but thank goodness it did. Amazing value, great food(with vegan options) and planet friendly. Plus it‚Äôs a great way to explore the Chicago food scene without breaking the bank. Treat yourself to a new restaurant every night. What more can you hope for.

title: Great Idea‚Ä¶ questionable means
text: The idea is awesome. They should allow consumers to check the list of available markets or zip codes, instead of having yo download the app, sign in, and all of that; just to find out they are not available in your area. So the total number of downloads does not reflect the total number of users, just people that wanted to see if the service was available in their area and were pushed to download an app.

title: Amazing app
text: App works flawlessly. So many Great options here in NYC. You can save a ton of money and get delicious meals while also preventing food waste. Some restaurants even give you a little choice when you arrive. this is a must-have app, especially for people who are not picky-eaters.

title: No notification
text:
Eh! I tried this yesterday and I had to pick up my order 24 hours later. I thought I would remember, but life happened and threw me off schedule. So obviously I forgot. Yes, it‚Äôs my responsibility to remember and add it to my calendar or make a reminder on Alexa or write it down. 

But why can‚Äôt the app have an automaticoffer to  create a calendar event? Why isn‚Äôt there a clear easy way to set up automatic notifications for orders you place? That‚Äôs a no brainer to me. Any business that wants to maximize user experience does that. C‚Äômon even USPS does it. 

So now I just don‚Äôt care to do this because it already cost me $4. $4 to remind myself that I don‚Äôt have the organization skills to remember random days when to drive to the mall to pick some random thing up. 

Whatever. The food isn‚Äôt worth the gas.

title: Absolutely worth it!
text: This app is great for food budgeting! I use it on quality bakeries that like to keep their shelf product fresh. Even though the food isn‚Äôt fresh to their standards, it doesn‚Äôt mean it should be discarded, as it is more than edible. I have absolute respect for businesses that enroll in this app.

title: Great Potential
text: It took me all of 60 seconds to realize this app wouldn‚Äôt work for me, but I‚Äôm still giving it 5 stars because it‚Äôs such a fantastic idea with lots of potential. I can‚Äôt reap the benefits (because I live in Alaska and trendy apps like this never make their way up here), but that doesn‚Äôt mean someone else couldn‚Äôt!

title: Such an amazing concept and great way to spend money!
text: First time trying today and received so many goods for only 4.99! Such an amazing concept, so much food always goes to waste in this big city and it always angers me because so many people would appreciate that food. This really is such an awesome idea, it makes me so happy!

title: Trying new or different restaurants
text: This app allows me to try different menus without spending full price. I am on a fixed budget due to retirement and I‚Äôm looking for different ways to try new foods in different areas. This particular store. a mile from my home.

title: Time availability before it being posted
text: I‚Äôve wanted a specific store for a month now, but every time I go into the app it says it was gone within minutes of it‚Äôs posted time. Today I got into the app at 9:17pm before the store posted at 9:18pm and once it turned 9:18 it sold out instantly. The app says it sold out at 9:15 and that is why this app is getting two stars.

title: Something I‚Äôve been looking for for a while now
text: I have always been worried about the amount of food that goes to waste everyday at restaurants.. so this app kinda takes care of that problem‚Ä¶ I really appreciate the creator of this app

title: My savior!
text: This app is great as a college student on a tight budget, it also feels great to save good food from being wasted, and luckily I have a lot of healthy options in my area, which would be so much more expensive before. The app encourages me to try new things. Always a steal!

title: Love, love, love it!
text: This app is great! It‚Äôs pretty easy to use, and I love the ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù factor that goes with not knowing what you‚Äôre gonna get. So far, they‚Äôve all been good surprises! My neighbors like it, too, because I always share what I get. And I feel good about helping prevent food waste. Thank you, Too Good To Go!

title: Suggestion for added flexibility
text: This message is a suggestion for the app. I love this concept and more places are offering TGTG, so now my Favorites is unwieldy. In a future update, can you offer Favorites to have custom labels? Eg Work, Home, Lunch, etc? Then I could categorize my faves by neighborhood or timing and make it more manageable.

title: Great Way to get good quality food affordably
text: Whoever thought in creating this application and also thank you to everyone who made it happen. Thank you for helping people like me to have a decent food plate while still having a budget to Perdue my responsibilities and dreams. Xoxo :)

title: you won‚Äôt regret it
text: This app is seriously amazing. I‚Äôve gotten such great deals and multiple meals for under $10. Not to mention that it‚Äôs good for the environment and for businesses. They‚Äôre also super fast with refunds if things don‚Äôt work out.  I recommend this to everyone.

title: Misfit Markets + CHOPPED + (ethical) Black Friday Shopping??
text: Ok WOW. I just picked up a $5.99 bag of produce from OK Produce at Reading Terminal Market. My bag included over $25 worth of fresh fruits and vegetables when I plugged my same items and quantities into the Walmart app. I absolutely love this idea and can't wait to try all kinds of new places while reducing food waste!

title: Great for the planet
text: Wonderful idea! Love being able to treat my family to restaurant food during these difficult times. Its great for the planet and your wallet. Thank you to whomever created this app! I hope to pick up and order at least once a week!

title: Love this App
text: I love this app and really recommend it to anyone looking for good deals on food! All of my surprise bags have had a good quantity of food for the price and it has been an easy, quick experience to order and pick up the food. Such a great way to reduce food waste!

title: 4 stars for a reason
text: I am new to this app and, maybe there is already a way to work around this but: for such a great idea and noble cause my first experience was to get a very good value (good amount of very delicious food) that would have otherwise ‚Äúgone to waste‚Äù‚Ä¶ packaged for me in very eco-unfriendly plastic clam shell containers. Kind of disappointed with that.

title: All bots
text: This app seriously needs updating so that you can prove you are not a bot. All the popular bags immediately get sold out right when they are available. No human can possibly go through all the prompts to buy the bags as fast as they say they are sold out. I have tried numerous times for the most popular bags for months right when they are available and they are always sold out. Your only chance of getting one is if whoever bought the bag gets a refund for it.

title: Delicious food and genius app
text: This was my first experience of reserving a surprise bag fr Too Good to Go ordering fr a local restaurant, Caliento Bistro Kitchen. Pick up took less than a minute and the surprise had a full meal of perfectly seasoned, roasted chicken quarter, red rice and tasty beans. Will definitely continue using the app and order fr Caliento Bistro again.

title: Great concept
text:
I love that this exists. Very happy to help reduce food waste. I wonder if there‚Äôs a way to use the resources of this app to help feed homeless people as well.

My only negative experiences have been with one particular restaurant that cancels my order almost every time. Discourages me from using the app.

title: The 20 minute pickup window is ridiculous
text: Ok, my family, in a more populated area, loves this and I‚Äôve tried. But im my area the restaurants and stores have 20-30 minute pick up window! From 6pm-6:30 and 11:30pm-11:50pm I mean how inflexible is that and nearly impossible for anyones schedule. So of course if any traffic you are out of luck! I‚Äôve missed two pick ups due to construction traffic or rush hour‚Ä¶. And no lenience or compensation am just nope out of food after the trip. One more try and I‚Äôm done. Chicagoland area.

title: Awesome & simple to use
text: Wow! I don‚Äôt usually leave reviews, but this app is amazing. We‚Äôre in Philadelphia & every time I‚Äôve used it the process is super simple & the food is delicious. We love that it allows us to try the variety of awesome food around us for a bargain! Cannot recommend enough.

title: Great idea, great app
text: the restaurants i have found for surprise bags have given me so much food for so cheap. great for getting random bagels and ice cream. you don‚Äôt get to choose what you get, but you can‚Äôt pass up 13 bagels for 5 bucks. i wish more cities had toogoodtogo restaurants!

title: Where has this been all my life?
text: An absolutely amazing idea. Great if you are frugal or environmentally conscious (or both!) Super easy to find restaurants near you with the map and you can review the individual restaurants as well. I have told everyone I know about this.

title: Great App
text: An amazing app and business concept. I just wish there was a vegetarian only option for stores. Or a way to put that preference in before you go to pick up. It stops me from ordering a lot because I don‚Äôt eat meat and don‚Äôt want to risk it. Desserts get old sometimes and I‚Äôd like to try something savory on the app.

title: Amazing
text: I didn‚Äôt believe my neighbor when she told me about this. Gave it a try and now I‚Äôm hooked. To the creators of this app: THANK YOU!!!! We are saving a ton of money and getting amazing food for incredible prices.  Less food waste on their end. Well done creators. Well done.  I‚Äôm blown away.

title: Googan‚Äôs Galley
text: First time in establishment but plan on going back soon. Spent many summers years ago in Essex and looking forward to trying some of many other choices on menu. Employees working the day I visited were extremely friendly and welcoming.

title: Decent app but needs an UI / UX overhaul
text:
Great initiative but the filtering and sorting options in the app are a bit furstrating: Why isn‚Äôt there a filtering option in the browser as simple as Collection Time Today / Tomorrow / All ?

Also Nearby (under Discover) is not properly sorted by shortest distance to your location and shows Sold Out entries‚Ä¶ why?!

title: Amazing program
text: I got my very first surprise bag at Ward Berry farm in Sharon. There was dill and collard greens and brussels sprouts and a large cookie and parsley and grapes. I was so happy with everything that was in there. It was the best experience. Thank you for the businesses that participate. It is a great shop and everybody was so nice and I will be back to shop inside :-)

title: Great Customer Service
text: I contacted them after noticing a potential mistake on my order. They were happy to work with me and changed the dynamic of this experience, as well as my decision on future visits. All in all, the food was delicious, and the staff was friendly.

title: BEST FOOD APP ON THE MARKET
text: Wow. I‚Äôm one for a discount but this takes it to the next level. I adore this app, what it stands for and of course what it offers. Not only is it fun to browse around what restaurants are offering what products, but it‚Äôs also really easy to use. This is an app I‚Äôve been looking for. Kudos!

title: Bring back ‚Äúsold out‚Äù
text: The new updates stopped having the ‚Äúsold out‚Äù button on auto. Fine. Now it‚Äôs gone entirely and makes map view absolutely unusable. I have to click on so many random gray bubbles just to get to a green bubble nearby. It‚Äôs wildly annoying and I can‚Äôt for the life of me figure out why they‚Äôve removed this feature.

title: Great idea
text: The app is a great idea but the options of local food is just Indian, pastries and some form of markets. Not many dinner options, unless you want sides? I‚Äôd prefer going to food banks than this. 2 stars for the app idea but I‚Äôd give it 1 star for food options. I‚Äôm not that desperate to ‚Äúenjoy‚Äù leftovers.

title: To Good To Go prevents food wastage.
text: I like the idea of participating in a program that prevents food wastage from restaurants and food stores. The benefit to me personally is that we get healthy foods at greatly discounted prices while we help our local restaurants/food stores eliminate food wastage by selling leftovers at a discount.

title: Works when it works
text: You have about a 75% chance of getting your food when you arrive. Bakery‚Äôs seem more reliable than anything. It wouldn‚Äôt be annoying except you take a specific time to go out if your way and are faced with belligerent employees who say they are out. Needs better control of what‚Äôs actually available.

title: Waste of time in the suburbs
text: I drove twenty minutes to pick up an order. When I arrived, the restaurant cancelled the order just as the pickup window opened. What a waste of my time and gas! I had no means of reviewing the order after their cancellation, which means that the restaurant‚Äôs great reviews exclude these frustrating and expensive experiences. There are very few restaurants on the app in my area, so you end up really dredging the bottom of the barrel. If you‚Äôre not in a major city, I‚Äôd skip this app.
